intro: Lissochilus medemiae, commonly known as the Medem’s rock orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found in the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, often fragrant flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapted to the harsh mountain climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
